A TRACE?: LITTLE RUNAWAY TWINS DISCOVER THEIR LATE MOM'S BELONGINGS IN A DUMPSTER
Two runaway boys slipped to the back of an upmarket strip mall. They hurried toward the closest dumpster.
"See? It wasn't so difficult to get away from that foster family," Steve said.
Mike lifted the dumpster lid. "They'll report us to Child Protective Services though, and then we'll have to worry about cops," he sighed. "And there's nothing to eat in this dumpster."
Steve removed a cardboard box. There wasn't food inside it, just a shabby jacket.
"This might work as a pillow, right?" He said, lifting it.
Mike rolled his eyes, digging deeper into the dumpster. Steve saw something inside the jacket's pocket.
"Mike! Our mom...she had the same one," Steve grabbed his brother's shoulder and showed what was in his hand.
"Do you even remember our mom passed away?" Mike asked. But then he turned pale, seeing what his twin brother held in his hand.

ON OUR ANNIVERSARY, MY HUSBAND "GIFTED" ME WITH DIVORCE PAPERS, LEAVING ME FOR A YOUNG MISTRESS — A MINUTE LATER, HE RECEIVED PAYBACK FROM KARMA
"But… We could have dinner," He cut me off before I could finish.
"I'm not in the mood for this," Todd said, not even looking at me. "Oh, I almost forgot. This is for you," he said, thrusting an envelope to me.
For a moment, there was a hope. Maybe he hadn't forgotten... Was this the ticket to Italy? My hands shaking as I opened the envelope.
But when I saw what was inside, my world crumbled. It wasn't a ticket to Italy.
It was divorce papers.
"What…what is...?" I stammered.
"Are you THAT dumb? I'm divorcing you," he said coldly as he pulled out his suitcase.
This couldn't be happening. Not after everything I had done for him, for us.
"May I ask why?" I asked, my mind reeling.
"Jeez, you're terrible, Katie!" he said bluntly, tossing clothes into the suitcase. "Just look at yourself! You do nothing. You've gained weight, you're not interesting!"
I felt like I had been slapped. "Are you kidding? Todd, we've been together for 15 years! You can't just—"
"I can. I met someone. Stephanie. She's wonderful." he said, cutting me off again. "What did you expect? That I'd stay with you when you're like this? And please, stop this scene," Todd said, zipping up his suitcase and heading for the door.
I followed him, speechless.
"Stephanie and I are going to Italy for two weeks. Get out of here by the time I return," he said, walking out.
I bolted out the front door, not caring about anything except anger. As I saw him, his phone pressed to his ear, smiling like total jerk. Oh, right. HE IS A TOTAL JERK!
I wanted to yell at him, to say it all. But before I could say a word, I saw it: Karma immediately hit him.
And Dear Lord. It was so damn brutal.
Here's what happened....⬇
